data.meanings: to be right/good/honest/upright/sound/righteous, suit, fit. aslaha - to set a thing aright, reform, do good. saalihaat - good works, fit and suiting deeds. aslaha (vb. 4) - to make whole sound, set things right, effect an agreement between, render fit. islaah - uprightness, reconciliation, amendment, reformation. muslihun - reformer, one who is upright, righteous, a person of integrity, peacemaker, suitable.saalih - name of a prophet sent to the tribe of Thamuud.
data.sentence: The word الصَّالِحَاتِ comes from the root ص ل ح and is associated with the meanings: to be right/good/honest/upright/sound/righteous, suit, fit. aslaha - to set a thing aright, reform, do good. saalihaat - good works, fit and suiting deeds. aslaha (vb. 4) - to make whole sound, set things right, effect an agreement between, render fit. islaah - uprightness, reconciliation, amendment, reformation. muslihun - reformer, one who is upright, righteous, a person of integrity, peacemaker, suitable.saalih - name of a prophet sent to the tribe of Thamuud.
The word هِيَ comes from the root ه ي and is associated with the meanings: she

data.meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.
data.sentence: The word يَعْمَلُونَ comes from the root ع م ل and is associated with the meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.

data.meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
data.sentence: The word يَهْدِي comes from the root ه د ي and is associated with the meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.

data.meanings: become/feel safe/secure, state of security/safety, trust, become quiet/tranquil in heart/mind, become free of expectation of evil or free of an object of dislike/hatred, promise/assurance of security/safety, become trustful/faithful/confident, to believe/acknowledge it, manifestation of humility/submission
data.sentence: The word الْمُؤْمِنِينَ comes from the root ا م ن and is associated with the meanings: become/feel safe/secure, state of security/safety, trust, become quiet/tranquil in heart/mind, become free of expectation of evil or free of an object of dislike/hatred, promise/assurance of security/safety, become trustful/faithful/confident, to believe/acknowledge it, manifestation of humility/submission

data.meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
data.sentence: The word كَبِيرًا comes from the root ك ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
The word أَجْرًا comes from the root ا ج ر and is associated with the meanings: recompense/compensation/reward, hire/pay/wage for service, profit

data.meanings: to recite/read, compilation, collection, reading, recitation, explanation, study, investigation.
data.sentence: The word الْقُرْءَانَ comes from the root ق ر ا and is associated with the meanings: to recite/read, compilation, collection, reading, recitation, explanation, study, investigation.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word أَقْوَمُ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
